intro: Sannantha crassa, commonly known as the broad-leaved sannantha, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its robust, hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. Sannantha crassa is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
